page.title: 13LANDSCAPE:ASHLEWORTH
page.content: Ashleworth presents an attractive riverside {Landscape.}Lush meadows adjoin the {River Severn }with the first settled buildings clustered at the ancient ferry point:the Church, Court,Tithe Barn and Elizabethan Manor House.The ground rises gently towards the old village centred around the {Village Green }and then towards the hundred foot contour,where the Post Office is,another focal point of old and new buildings.The road to Hasfield runs by Ashleworth Ham,a wetland area and{Nature Reserve.}Hasfield is a pretty hamlet which almost seems to have been preserved in a time capsule,with a picturesque Church, Georgian Old Rectory,Victorian Mansion and the interesting Great House.Both villages continue to slope upwards towards their north and west boundaries.
